com.compendium.core.db.management
Class DBBackupDatabase

java.lang.Object
  com.compendium.core.db.management.DBBackupDatabase
All Implemented Interfaces:
DBConstants, DBConstantsDerby, DBConstantsMySQL, java.io.Serializable
public class DBBackupDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
implements DBConstants, DBConstantsMySQL, DBConstantsDerby

This class is responsible for backing up user databases. Information is stored as SQL statements in a text file. It allows external classes to register DBProgressListeners and fires appropriate progress information to them. This facilitates the display of progress information in a user interface, if desired.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

DBBackupDatabase

public DBBackupDatabase(int nDatabaseType,
                        java.lang.String sDatabaseUserName,
                        java.lang.String sDatabasePassword,
                        java.lang.String sDatabaseIP)
Constructor, creates an empty Vector to hold the DBProgressListeners which may be registered. This constructor also takes a name and password to use when accessing the database and the IP address of the server machine.

Parameters:
nDatabaseType, - the type of the database being used (e.g, MySQL, Derby).
sDatabaseUserName, - the name to use when creating the connection to the database
sDatabasePassword, - the password to use when connection to the database
sDatabaseIP, - the IP address of the server machine. The default if 'localhost'.
Method Detail

backupDatabase

public void backupDatabase(java.lang.String sName,
                           java.io.File file,
                           boolean fullRecreation)
                    throws DBDatabaseTypeException,
                           java.io.IOException,
                           java.sql.SQLException,
                           java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Store the data in the database with the given name, into the passed File, as SQL statments

Parameters:
String - sName, the database name of the database to backup.
File - file, a file object representing the file to write the backedup data to.
boolean - fullRecreation, indicates whether data only, or delete and create statment should be sotred to file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
java.sql.SQLException
DBDatabaseTypeException

backupDatabaseToZip

public void backupDatabaseToZip(java.lang.String sName,
                                java.lang.String sFriendlyName,
                                java.io.File file,
                                boolean fullRecreation,
                                boolean bKeepPaths,
                                UserProfile oUser)
                         throws DBDatabaseTypeException,
                                java.io.IOException,
                                java.sql.SQLException,
                                java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Store the data in the database with the given name, into the passed zip File, as SQL statments with external resource files.

Parameters:
sName - the database name of the database to backup.
sFriendlyName - the name of the project that the user sees.
file - a file object representing the file to write the backedup data to.
fullRecreation - indicates whether data only, or delete and create statment should be sotred to file.
bWithResources - indicates whether associated resource should also be backed up.
bToZip - indicates whether backup and resource should be zipped.
oUser - the current user backing up - required for creating the correct backup path for the Linked Files area.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
java.sql.SQLException
DBDatabaseTypeException

private void backupTables(java.sql.Connection con,
                          boolean fullRecreation)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
Backup the all the tables in the database opened on the given connection.

Parameters:
Connection - con, the connection object to use to read the data from the database.
boolean - fullRecreation, indicates if the table drop and create statement should be stored to file.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

addProgressListener

public void addProgressListener(DBProgressListener listener)
Adds DBProgressListener to listeners notified when progress events happen.

removeProgressListener

public void removeProgressListener(DBProgressListener listener)
Removes DBProgressListener from listeners notified of progress events.

public void removeAllProgressListeners()
Removes all listeners notified about progress events.

protected void fireProgressCount(int nCount)
